synopsis.p: Writes each section in three files in the BioNLP challenge format.

description.p: writes sections, annotations and tuples in the BioNLP challenge format. Each document will be written into three distinct files with the extensions: txt, a1 and a2.

param-doc.name: documentFilter
param-doc.p: Only process document that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: words
param-doc.p: Word annotations. This expression is evaluated as a list of elements (only annotations are retained) with the current section as the context element.

param-doc.name: entities
param-doc.p: Entity type / Entities pairs. Expressions are evaluated as a lists of elements (only annotations are retained) with the current section as the context element.

param-doc.name: active
param-doc.p: This expression is evaluated as a boolean with the corpus as the context element, the module will process the document only if the result is true.

param-doc.name: sectionFilter
param-doc.p: Process only sections that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: dependencies
param-doc.p: Dependency tuples. This expression is evaluated as a list of elements (only tuples are retained) with the current section as the context element.

param-doc.name: fileName
param-doc.p: Name of the output files prefix. This expression is evaluated as a string with the current section as the context element.

param-doc.name: entityForm
param-doc.p: Surface forms of each entity. This expression is evaluated as a string with the annotation as the context element.

param-doc.name: labelFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the feature containing the label dependenct.

param-doc.name: sentences
param-doc.p: Sentence annotations. This expression is evaluated as a list of elements (only annotations are retained) with the current section as the context element.

param-doc.name: sentenceForm
param-doc.p: Surface forms of each sentence. This expression is evaluated as a string with the annotation as the context element.

param-doc.name: wordForm
param-doc.p: Surface forms of each word. This expression is evaluated as a string with the annotation as the context element.

param-doc.name: userFunctions
param-doc.p: Set user functions available for this module. If this module is a sequence, then all compounds inherit its functions.
